title: Generic Crafting System
description: Need to craft stuff? Want craft professions, levels, ingredients, etc? GCS will get you started!
longDescription:
Video: <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KoP4-H-qTzI&feature=youtu.be">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KoP4-H-qTzI&feature=youtu.be</>

This system provides you with tools for handling your item creation-crafting needs in your projects. It allows for : Custom Craft Classes (blacksmithing, alchemy, someweirdsmithing etc.), Item Requirements, Level Requirements, Recipe Requirements, Ingredient with custom Categories (i.e. setting certain items to be “vials” and certain items to be “bases”, then setting Alchemy to require 1 vial and 1 base to be crafted) etc. 

It gives you functions that do various crafting tasks such as getting the outcome of a crafting operation, outputting the change in your inventory, levels gained, required items, getting all of the current craftables etc. All of it is customizable from the categories to the trend with which levels are gained in a class. 

It will work with Static Meshes, Skeletal Meshes, Actor Classes and Actors. This is what makes the system generic; it will work with almost all inventory types. In the video, using the tools of this system, I have created two different crafting system types to give you an idea on what you can hope to achieve with this system. That level will also be present in the content; I have commented all of it so you can check them out directly in case you want to achieve similar results. 

All of it is handled with one actor BP in your levels, the rest of it is all functions in a library. Most of it is achieved with Structures and inceptions of loops running over arrays.
technicalDetails:
­This is NOT a “plug&play” system : it will provide you with tools for creating crafting systems for your own likings and the needs of your project. The two crafting systems you see in the video are not designed to work in your projects, they are for showcasing the system and what you can achieve with it. 

­Crafting is a highly “subjective” topic; my goal with coding is never assuming anything as to the usage of the system so that it will serve everyone with different purposes. This is why this system is left at such a basic level. If you have any requests regarding its usage or implementation, please let me know in the support thread so I will keep improving the system in  the path that will suit the needs of everyone.
